results.title: Circus in Europe
results.brief_description: The arrival of a small circus in a European town, and the parade through the streets. Some of the circus acts are shown, including animal acts and acrobatics. No commentary except for some brief words in German by the circus ringmaster.
results.description: The arrival of a small circus in a European town, and the parade through the streets. Some of the circus acts are shown, including animal acts and acrobatics. No commentary except for some brief words in German by the circus ringmaster.

results.title: The Circus baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Tells the story of the mother elephant who learns that she should not try to get her baby to act like a human. Iconographic animation. From the book written and illustrated by Maud and Miska Petersham. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Circulatory System [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.

results.title: Circulation of the blood
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A study, mainly in animated diagram, of the systematic and pulmonary circulation of the blood in the human body; showing the structure and functions of the heart, lungs, arteries, veins and capillary network. The route of the blood, the heart cycle and the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide in the air sacs of the lungs and the cells of the body are shown in detail.
results.description: A study, mainly in animated diagram, of the systematic and pulmonary circulation of the blood in the human body; showing the structure and functions of the heart, lungs, arteries, veins and capillary network. The route of the blood, the heart cycle and the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide in the air sacs of the lungs and the cells of the body are shown in detail.

results.title: Circulation and the human body. -- Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the needs of the body’s cells and how some of these needs are serviced by the circulation system. It details how blood returns from the capillaries to the heart through the venous system, and how the chambers of the heart pump the blood through the pulmonary circulation, then back through the arterial system to the capillaries.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: A Circle is determined by three points
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
The three degrees of freedom of a circle - the radius and the co-ordinates of the centre - are reduced stage by stage until finally three points are given. Animated diagrams.
